**Bartok the Magnificent (1999)**

**Plot Summary:**

"Bartok the Magnificent" is an animated adventure film that follows the misadventures of a scheming raven named Bartok. Released in 1999, the film is set in a mystical and whimsical world where animals and mythical creatures coexist. Directed by Tony Bancroft and produced by Fox Animation Studios, this film is a delightful blend of humor, adventure, and a touch of heartwarming sentiment.

Bartok (voiced by Christopher Lloyd) is a self-proclaimed "master of disguise" and a con artist who lives in the kingdom of Ravenswood. Despite his grandiose claims, Bartok is often outsmarted by his own schemes and is more of a bumbling sidekick than a mastermind. His best friend is a dim-witted bat named Frritt-Arri (voiced by Frank Welker), who is always ready to assist Bartok in his harebrained plans.

One day, Bartok overhears a plot by the evil Queen Elanor (voiced by Jodi Benson) to kidnap the Princess of Ravenswood and transform her into a bird, thus securing the queen’s power over the kingdom. Seeing an opportunity to make a quick buck, Bartok decides to kidnap the princess himself and ransom her back to the queen. However, things go awry when he accidentally kidnaps the wrong princess—a young, spirited, and resourceful girl named Yelena (voiced by Lacey Chabert) from a neighboring kingdom.

Initially, Yelena is terrified and angry at her captor, but as they journey through the forest, she and Bartok form an unlikely friendship. Yelena, with her quick wit and courage, helps Bartok out of several dangerous situations, and he begins to see her as more than just a means to an end. Meanwhile, the real Princess of Ravenswood is kidnapped by Queen Elanor, and the kingdom is thrown into chaos.

As Bartok and Yelena travel, they encounter a variety of colorful characters, including a wise old owl named Archibald (voiced by Jim Cummings) and a group of mischievous woodland creatures. These encounters provide both comic relief and valuable lessons for Bartok, who starts to question his selfish motives.

The plot thickens when Bartok learns that Queen Elanor’s true plan is to use a magical amulet to transform all the humans in the kingdom into birds, thus ensuring her eternal rule. Realizing the gravity of the situation, Bartok decides to do the right thing and help Yelena return to her kingdom to warn her family and stop the queen’s evil plan.

The journey back is fraught with danger, as Queen Elanor’s minions are hot on their trail. Bartok and Yelena must use all their wits and courage to outsmart the queen’s forces and reach the kingdom in time. Along the way, Bartok’s transformation from a selfish trickster to a brave hero is complete, and he learns the true meaning of friendship and bravery.

In a climactic showdown, Bartok and Yelena confront Queen Elanor and her henchmen. Using a combination of cunning and teamwork, they manage to thwart the queen’s plans and save the kingdom. In the end, Bartok is hailed as a hero, and he and Yelena part ways with a newfound respect and affection for each other.

"Bartok the Magnificent" is a charming and entertaining film that combines elements of fantasy, adventure, and comedy. It delivers a heartwarming message about the power of friendship and the importance of doing the right thing, even when it’s difficult.
